body.p: IAS 19 before its revision in 1998 did not specify which forms of accrued benefit valuation method should be permitted under the benchmark treatment. IAS 19 as revised in 1998 required a single accrued benefit method: the most widely used accrued benefit method, which is known as the projected unit credit method (sometimes known as the ‘accrued benefit method pro‑rated on service’ or as the ‘benefit/years of service method’).
